text: Powell Allen Moore (January 5, 1938 â€“ August 13, 2018) was an American politician and public servant. He was an official in the United States Department of State and the United States Department of Defense. He was born in Milledgeville, Georgia. Moore was Assistant Secretary of State for Legislative Affairs from February 8, 1982 to August 5, 1983 during the Ronald Reagan administration. He was Assistant Secretary of Defense for Legislative Affairs from May 4, 2001 until December 2004 during the George W. Bush administration. In 2006, President Bush nominated him to be the Representative to the Organization for Security and Co-operation in Europe. Moore left government service in 2009 and worked at a law firm. Moore died in Washington, D.C. on August 13, 2018 at the age of 80. ==References== ==Other websites== *Profile from Venable Category:1938 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Military people from Georgia (U.S. state) Category:Lawyers from Georgia (U.S. state) Category:Politicians from Georgia (U.S. state)
title: Powell A. Moore
